main event: An unidentified flying object was observed as a bright light that hovered briefly and then zigzagged rapidly away in Topeka, Kansas on March 30, 1966.
interesting points: The object was noted for its unusual maneuvers, including hovering and rapid zigzagging, Witnesses reported the object as a very bright light, brighter than the brightest stars., The sighting lasted for a total of approximately 5 minutes., Multiple military personnel at Forbes AFB were reported to have observed the same object., The conclusion of the report as to the nature of the sighting was considered 'very probable.'
sighted object: a bright light moving in the sky
